communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CISA IRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The CISA Incident Reporting System provides a secure web-enabled means of reporting computer security incidents to CISA ( OMB Control No.: 1670-0037 - https://us-cert.cisa.gov/forms/report). This system assists analysts in providing timely handling of security incidents as well as the ability to conduct improved analysis. I am requesting the records for every incident submitted to CISA through their Incident Reporting System submitted from January 1, 2020 until today’s date. These records should include but are not limited to an Incident ID, Incident Description, Date, Organizational Details ( including but not limited to a Name of Org ). 

Along with the above incident reports, I also am requesting any malware artifacts submitted to the Department of Homeland Security under the "US-CERT AMAC Malware Analysis Submissions" form ( https://www.malware.us-cert.gov/ ) since January 1 2020. These records should include any file submissions as well as the aforementioned form fields.

If possible, I would prefer that these records be provided in a machine-readable format such as a PDF, CSV or Excel file, and transferred electronically. If you cannot transfer the requested records electronically to my email, then please send them on a CD-ROM.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Maryland Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of fees and debt for incarcerated youth (i.e., juvenile):

All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department/office or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

title: Request for documents containing the name "Bruce Hume"

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Request for documents containing the name "Bruce Hume"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents/records referring to Bruce Hume or containing the name of Bruce Hume during the time period of 2010 - 2015. During this time period Bruce R. Hume was a resident of Wilton, Ct and employed by the Norwalk Police Department.

Detective Debra Hartin of the Gilbert P.D. had multiple interfaces and communications with the Wilton Ct. PD and the Surprise, AZ PD concerning Bruce Hume's harassment allegations concerning Scott Huminski in 2011-2013.

At the time, I was a resident of Gilbert and Detective Hartin was communicating with police agencies about this matter.   As such, the "Bruce Hume" documents and materials may also be located in a record search related to Justin M. Nelson or Scott Huminski.

Here are the Wilton Connecticut reports on the Bruce Hume issue mentioned Detective Hartin of the Gilbert PD and her status of being on the case.  These documents are available to the public via Muckrock.

https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2017/01/19/1100010541.pdf

https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2017/01/19/1200009492.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia State Open Records Law - Request
communications.communication:
Dear Sir / Madam, 

I am writing to ask for your help with a request under the  Virginia State Open Records Law, Va Code sec §2.2-3700 - §2.2-3714.

Would it be possible for you to send me a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:

1.	A list of ALL types of alternative asset investments, including private equity, venture capital, distressed debt, mezzanine, fund of funds, infrastructure, natural resources, real estate and private debt partnerships in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and
2.	For each partnership, may I please have a copy of any alternative assets investment records that would show some or all of the following information:

a.	Richmond Retirement System's total commitment to the partnership,
b.	the total contributions made by Richmond Retirement System to the partnership to date,
c.	the total distributions received by Richmond Retirement System from the partnership to date,
d.	the estimated current value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in the partnership, and
e.	any available estimates of the Net and Gross IRR earned by Richmond Retirement System to date on its investment in the partnership.

3.	In addition to this could you please provide me with an up to date account of your current asset allocations in the above asset classes including any direct investments you may have.

Thank you very much for your attention to this request. In the event that Richmond Retirement System has no such investments, a simple note to this effect will suffice.  We understand that we may be charged for the cost of the copies requested, and agree to pay these charges. 

Please send the requested records via e-mail to foia@preqin.com

Thank you again for your attention to this request. 

Yours faithfully,

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Records of Facility Assessments Performed
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Per the CPS Facilities Condition Assessment page at https://www.cps.edu/services-and-supports/school-facilities/facility-condition-assessment 
"CPS is required to complete a comprehensive biennial condition assessment of each facility owned, leased, or operated by the district. CPS hires an independent firm to conduct the facility assessments. Assessment teams are made up of experienced building professionals including professional engineers, registered architects, and certified project managers."

Please provide records sufficient to show if and when these assessments have been performed since 2020, and if performed, at which schools. Please note that I am not requesting the contents of these assessments. I am requesting records documenting that they occurred. 

Requested information includes, but is not limited to: the schools assessed, the date(s) of assessment, and the firm(s) which performed them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Moser

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Salaries (2002-2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide a complete list of all police department employees for the years 2002-2022, including employee name, department, job title, hire date, base salary and/or hourly wage as applicable, bonus compensation (where applicable), overtime wages (where applicable), and total compensation.

I am aware of the salary information posted at https://data.seattle.gov, however it is not responsive to this request because it does not include hire date, base pay, bonuses, overtime, or total compensation information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Your Walla Walla County public records request #23-382 has been opened.
communications.communication:
Walla Walla County ************************************************************************ Your record request #23-382 has been submitted successfully. This letter serves as Walla Walla County’s initial five-day letter, pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, to your public records request. After your request is reviewed for content and we determine the department or office in which your request refers to, the County will provide an estimate to provide an initial installment of responsive records. After locating responsive records, the County will determine whether any of the responsive documents are subject to applicable exemptions under the Public Records Act, and to notify any third parties affected by the request. If third party notification is required, twenty (20) business days will be allowed for a response by the third party to those records which specifically pertain to them. As records are reviewed, they may be released on an installment basis. Additionally, the Washington Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and Walla Walla County Policy 7.4.3.1 (BoCC Resolution #17-249) now allow the County to charge for provision of electronic records. Refer to the hyperlinked documents for the fee schedule for future records installments. As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Walla Walla County portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Walla Walla County through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Walla Walla County.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Mississippi State Employees' Education (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the Mississippi Executive Branch from January 1, 2019 to the present. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within the offices of the Governor and Lieutenant Governor and all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2019 to May 31, 2022.

For each month, I’m seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following fields for each employee: PERSONID and education level achieved (e.g., high school, 2 year degree, 4 year degree, etc.)

If this data does not exist, I would like to request instead a spreadsheet that shows, in each row, the education requirements for each occupation (i.e. CUROCC_OCCUNAME) in the state government, if applicable. 

I am comfortable working with large data sets and can receive the records in a variety of formats (.dbf, .csv, .mdb, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

communications.subject: RE: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Mississippi State Employees' Education (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
On June 20, 2023, we received your request for “electronic listings of all individuals employed within the offices of the Governor and Lieutenant Governor and all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 1, 2019 to May 31, 2022” [including] PERSONID and education level achieved [or] a spreadsheet that shows, in each row, the education requirements for each occupation in the state government.”

We do not maintain employee data for the offices of the governor and lieutenant governor, so we do not have data responsive to that part of your request.

Additionally, we do not maintain data regarding employee education level, but the education requirements for each job classification in Mississippi state government may be found in the job descriptions at https://careers.mspb.ms.gov/mississippi-careers.
If there is other data you are seeking, please clarify what you mean by “electronic listing” so we can respond to your request.  Please also note that our new system is unable to run monthly reports.  Our reports show employees during a specific time period and whether they are active or inactive at the time of the report.
If you have any questions, please contact me at (601) 359-2701.

Brittany Frederick
Communications Director

Mississippi State Personnel Board
210 E. Capitol Street, Suite 800
Jackson, MS 39201
Phone: 601.359.2701
Teams: 769.867.8961
www.mspb.ms.gov<http://www.mspb.ms.gov/>

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Bresett Disciplinary Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The complete disciplinary records of corrections officers Christopher J. Bresett, Gregory J. Bresett, and Gregory M. Bresett.

Citing the FOIL Subject Matter List of the Department of Corrections and Community Supervision last known to be updated February 16, 2021, the record would be listed under subheading "EMPLOYEE SUBJECTS" where this describes the following described records:

* Employee Investigations
* Executive Facility Files
* Human Resources/Personnel
* Labor Relations

Per legislation signed by the Governor on June 12, 2020, as Chapter 96 of the New York State Laws of 2020, these are now subject to release upon request through the state's Freedom of Information Law; records may not be withheld citing New York State Civil Rights Law 50-a (repealed).

Explicitly releasable are records including:

* complaints, allegations, and charges;
* the name of the employee complained of or charged;
* the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing;
* the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding;
* the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

title: Aggregated Data from Annual Financial Reports of Cemetery Corporations

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Aggregated Data from Annual Financial Reports of Cemetery Corporations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

RE: Division of Cemeteries

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law §87 et seq.), I am requesting access to or a copy of the aggregated data and/or database records from the annual financial reports submitted by cemetery corporations.

In particular, I am interested in the following parts of the reports:

1. Parts 1-3 of the Annual Financial Report of Cemetery Corporation (all cemeteries must complete Parts 1-3).
2. Part 4 of the Annual Financial Report of Cemetery Corporation, including Perpetual Care Reconciliation and PM Loans.
3 .Part 5 of the Annual Financial Report of Cemetery Corporation, including Pre-Need and Installment Sales.
4. Schedule A (2136-f).
5. Schedule B (2133-f).
6. Schedule C (2079).
If there are any fees involved in the process of retrieving these records, please inform me in advance. If some of this information is exempt from release, please release as much as possible under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Aggregated Data from Authorization for Cremation and Disposition Forms

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Aggregated Data from Authorization for Cremation and Disposition Forms
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

RE: Division of Cemeteries

I am writing to you under the provisions of the New York State Freedom of Information Law (Article 6 of the Public Officers Law) to request access to and a copy of the aggregated data derived from all "Authorization for Cremation and Disposition" forms that have been submitted from January 2019 through June 2023.

I understand that the Division of Cemeteries under the New York State Department of State may have this data as part of their regulatory oversight and reporting requirements.

If my request is too broad or does not reasonably describe the records, please inform me of this issue and I will provide more specific details. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me in advance of fulfilling my request.

Should you deny my request, or any part of the request, please state in writing the reasons for the denial. If you believe that these records, or any part of them, are exempt from disclosure, please provide an index of such records, stating the justification for each claimed exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Steve Horn FOIA Request - 6/18/23
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Any and all communications and materials related to the drafting, dissemination, and public release of the May 15, 2023 letter signed by the Attorney General and a group of other Attorneys General pertaining to both the Net-Zero Asset Owner Alliance (also known as "NZAOA" and please search both iterations) and the Net-Zero Insurance Alliance (also known as "NZIA" and please search both iterations). 

Please also send any PDF files created pertaining to this request in their original format. 

For reference, the letter cited can be seen here:

https://attorneygeneral.utah.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/2023-05-15-NZIA-Letter.pdf

2.) Any and all communications and other materials pertaining to the Net-Zero Insurance Alliance (also known as "NZIA" and please search both iterations) dating between Nov. 1, 2022 through the date of the fulfillment of this request.
Definitions

“Any” and “all” mean all, each, any, and every. “Address” and “mention” mean relates to, refers to, contains, describes, embodies, mentions, constitutes, constituting, supports, corroborates, demonstrates, proves, evidences, shows and/or concerns.

“Document(s)” means any and all written, typed, printed, recorded or graphic matter, however produced, reproduced or stored, whether an original or a copy, and whether prepared, published or released by any person or entity, including but not limited to letters, reports, agreements, correspondence, intra-office or inter-office correspondence, telegrams, minutes or records of meetings, reports or summaries, expressions or statements, lists, drafts and revisions, invoices, receipts, original and preliminary notes, sketches, records, ledgers, contracts, bills of lading, bills, inventories, financial data, maps, memoranda, accounting and financial records, diaries, journals, calendars, statements, work papers, videotapes, photographs, pamphlets, brochures, advertisements, trade letters, press releases, drawings, recaps, tables, articles, summaries of conversations, computer cards, tapes, diskettes, or other means of electronically or magnetically maintaining information, and printouts.

The term “document(s)” also includes electronically stored data from which information can be obtained either directly or by translation through detection devices or readers; any such document is to be produced in a reasonably legible and usable form. The term “document(s)” includes all drafts of a document and all copies that differ in any respect from the original, including any notation, underlining, marking, or information not on the original. The term also includes information stored in, or accessible through, computer or other information retrieval systems (including any computer archives or back-up systems), together with instructions and all other materials necessary to use or interpret such data compilations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Steve Horn.

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Steve Horn FOIA Request - 6/18/23
communications.communication:
Tom Nash,

This Office anticipates incurring costs when fulfilling your FOIA request. Pursuant to § 2.2-3704(F) of the Code of Virginia, this Office may make reasonable charges not to exceed the actual costs incurred in accessing, duplicating, supplying, or searching for the requested records. Additionally, if the estimated costs exceed $200, this Office may request a deposit in advance of processing your request, pursuant to § 2.2-3704(H) of the Code of Virginia. If you would like a cost estimate, please request one and it will be provided. Any costs incurred in estimating the cost of supplying the requested records shall be applied toward the overall charges.

Tyler Barnes
Assistant General Counsel

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Silvio Berlusconi
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records mentioning former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi (29 September 1936 – 12 June 2023). His death is widely-known and has been widely reported, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, see the following BBC article: https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65877241

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Silvio Berlusconi
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi (29 September 1936 – 12 June 2023). His death is widely-known and has been widely reported, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, see the following BBC article: https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-65877241

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA John Schultz Vietnam War
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

OMPF for John J. Schultz Jr. including cumulative record of training, history of assignments, military education, transfers and receipts, all military decorations and citations, personnel evaluations, unit awards, Bronze Star Medal citations, commendation medals, deployments South Vietnam.
1) History of Assignments NAVPERS form 601-5
2) Navy Occupational training history NAVPERS 601-4
3) Cumulative transfers and receipts NAVPERS 601-12, administrative remarks
4) Navy Commendation Medal citations
5) Bronze Star Medal award citations
Awards include Bronze Star Medal with Combat V, Navy Commendation Medal with Combat V, Combat Action Ribbon, good conduct medal, Presidential Unit Citation, Navy Unit Commendation, Vietnam Service Medal.
Service with UDT-21 Underwater Demolition Team twenty one, SEAL Team TWO ST-2, SEAL TEAM ONE ST1 Vietnam War 1967 to 1971, PRU advisor, Provincial Reconnaissance Unit, Phoenix Program CIA, LDNN ADVISOR (Lien Doc Nguoi Nhia) South Vietnamese “frogmen”, SASR, USNAB CORONADO, NSWU4, Naval Special Warfare Group TWO. Training includes Underwater Demolition Team Replacement training Little Creek, U.S. Navy Underwater Swimmers School, Basic Airborne School, Jungle Warfare School, SERE, Special Forces training, Weapons and demolitons, Fort Bragg. Navy SEAL.

Please redact any sensitive information protected in accordance with the Privacy Act of 1974.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eric Bradley
